title: Passwords not saving, even though I have it set to save  in Firefox
content: About 3 days ago, none of my passwords are being saved in Firefox. Several times a day I have to put in my username and password for various sites, even if I don't shut down my computer. I have save passwords selected in my security settings in Firefox, but still does not save. This all started when I went into my Firefox settings 3 days ago to clear the cache, and that's when it started not to save passwords.
creator: history1962

title: change Ca english to British version
creator: collin.robson

title: Allow 3rd party session cookies for Kaltura
content: I cannot figure this out, it was working around 10 minutes ago and now it's not. I use canvas for school and within that is Kaltura, used for uploading and recording lectures etc. I'm now being hit with the "It seems your browser is blocking 3rd party session cookies which are required for the Kaltura application. To resolve this issue, please update your settings to allow 3rd party cookies." and nothing I do seems to fix it. My settings are set to standard, didn't work. I tried to allow an exception but since it's embedded within the school canvas, I don't know how to get the Kaltura URL and the normal canvas url doesn't bypass it. I've went to the about:config and messed around with that based on other support posts, but that didn't work either. I went into the cookie setting and set it to custom and just unchecked the cookies, but that still didn't work. I'm at a complete loss and I need some help.
creator: angie.94

title: Hardware acceleration suddenly broken
content: Suddenly hardware acceleration does not work any more and I have black screens when trying to move or switch from a window playing Netflix. Nvidia 4080 super / Windows 11. It works fine when I disable hardware acceleration.
creator: robinedgar

title: Extensions keep disappearing
content: When I open my extensions and tap on one/open them, it only stays open for a few seconds then the extensions tab closes and this keeps happening every time I re-open it, I DON'T KNOW WHAT TO DO- HELP!!! Thanks :)

title: Update # 135.0 causing crash
content: Mac mini late 2012 running OS 10.15.7 Downloaded most recent Firefox update (135.0). Since then have experienced streaming site (Netflix, Amazon Prime Video, Max) freezing during watching film and then whole computer freezing and crashing so that I need to reboot the computer. Has anyone else reported this problem? What can I do to solve the problem?

title: firefox blocking access to banking account login
content: For some reason, I can no longer log into my bank account. This has not been an issue in the past. Does Mozilla offer users any phone support that allows me to review current application settings with a technician to help resolve this issue? If I switch to Chrome, I can log into the account. Please advise. Thank you Mike
